clothes also found in missing gaia investigation .

text: that 's all for today folks .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all of your news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: woman , 50 , 'strangled ex-gurkha '
text: woman , 50 , 'strangled ex-gurkha '

documents.title: woman , 50 , 'strangled ex-gurkha '
text: a former gurkha was strangled to death by a woman who then went to his home and fought for nearly five hours with his wife , a court has heard .
man limbu , 75 , was found dead at the home of sun maya tamang , 50 , in victoria road , aldershot , on 10 march .
his wife gayatri said she thought she was going to die during their struggle later that day .
she told the court : `` she was throttling my neck and pulling my hair , saying , 'i 'll kill you , i 'll kill you ' . ''
ms tamang denies murdering mr limbu , falsely imprisoning his 47-year-old wife and causing her actual bodily harm .
the trial at winchester crown court continues .

documents.title: gaia pope search : police investigate clothing
text: police investigating the disappearance of teenager gaia pope are searching in an area where items of women 's clothing were earlier found .
they were discovered by a member of the public on land near the dorset coast path .
it comes as a man , from the swanage area of dorset and known to the missing 19-year-old , has been arrested on sus of murder .

documents.title: sister 'blown away ' by amount of donations for children
text: pippa hughes ( right ) , the sister of sam kyme ( left ) , has been reacting to the news that they have raised more than £ 20,000 in donations , which will go towards the care of sam 's two sons after she dies of aggressive motor neurone disease .
she said : `` it 's amazing .
i 'm blown away .
i ca n't believe how much people have donated , how generous and kind people are .
`` we did n't think it would ever happen we 've appointed a solicitor who 's come today and we can move forward , it 's unbelievable .
`` i wish i could thank every single person that donates .
i just have n't got the time caring for sam 24 hours a day , but i want everyone to know that it 's just amazing .
`` you can tell by sam 's face , she ca n't say anything , but you can see by her reaction she just ca n't believe it . ''

documents.title: the price of football 2017
text: the results of the bbc price of football study have been released today and show the majority of ticket prices have been frozen or have fallen for a third year .
but despite this , a poll of young adult football fans suggests the cost is still putting them off .
the bbc has also created a price calculator to allow supporters to compare the cost of following their team with other sides in their league .
season ticket prices in the south
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: concern at 'fake grass ' trend
text: a wildlife trust is concerned the rising popularity of artificial fake grass is hurting wildlife .
berks , bucks & oxon wildlife trust ( bbowt ) says it is `` pretty much the same '' as concreting over the garden and means birds can not peck for worms .

artificial lawns are becoming more common according to faux grass , a supplier in oxfordshire , which says it 's seen a 15-18 % increase in the number of people choosing artificial lawns compared with last year .
its director ray bucknell says its not the problem bbowt claims it is , as people rarely cover their whole gardens , leaving plenty of space wildlife .
he added worms often thrived underneath the fake grass .
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: your views : school asking parents for stationary money 'very innovative '
text: readers on facebook have been responding to the news that robert piggott cofe school in wargrave has asked parents for a £ 1 daily donation to help pay for stationery and books .
audrey hicks says : `` very good idea , parents think nothing to spending £ 7 plus on one packet of cigarettes .
why not help the school ?
they have huge bills on maintenance , water , electricity etc . ''
ray hawkins asks : `` what have they spent their budget on that has caused this ? ? ?
other schools do n't have this problem . ''
asim pal says : `` thirty pounds a month minus holidays is a small amount meant to do a great job of saving a seat of learning .
very innovative . ''
glenda meeson says : `` you could buy your child a pen , and it would last a lot longer than a day a tidy profit could be made here .
be honest . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: secretary of state to intervene on eastleigh local plan
text: the government 's warning it could take over the running of housing policy at eastleigh borough council which it says has failed to produce a `` local plan '' to deal with the need for more homes .
sajid javid , secretary of state for communities and local government , says 70 local authorities still have n't adopted a plan , and he 's intervening in 15 cases , including eastleigh .

mims davies , mp for eastleigh , said : `` i have long been calling upon eastleigh borough council to get on and produce a well-supported local plan , so that my constituents can have confidence in their important role as our local planning authority . ''
she added : `` it is right that those councils that are not allowing their communities to benefit from that devolution of power must be taken to task . ''

documents.title: cps to get file on power station collapse
text: cps to get file on power station collapse

documents.title: gaia pope search : police give update
text: gaia pope search : police give update

documents.title: breakingcps to get file on power station collapse
text: police investigating the collapse of didcot power station are due to send a file to prosecutors before the end of the year , the bbc understands .
ken cresswell , 57 , john shaw , 61 , michael collings , 53 , and christopher huxtable , 34 , were killed when the boiler house came down on 23 february last year .
it took more than six months for the bodies to be recovered from the site .
thames valley police and the health and safety executive are investigating .
the bbc has learned a file is likely to be sent to crown prosecution service lawyers this year for them to review .

documents.title: father of missing gaia pope makes emotional appeal
text: father of missing gaia pope makes emotional appeal

documents.title: breakinggaia pope search : man arrested on sus of murder
text: police have arrested a 49-year-old man on sus of the murder of missing dorset teenager gaia pope .
detecives said the man is known to gaia .
the announcement comes after clothes were found near a coastal path .
it is not clear who the clothes belong to , but dorset police said gaia 's family have been informed .
gaia , 19 , was last seen nine days ago by family friend rosemary dinch , in swanage , dorset .

documents.title: murder accused was 'funding drug habit '
text: a man accused of being in a gang which shot dead a businessman during a botched burglary took part to `` fund his drug habit '' , a court has heard .
guy hedger , 61 , was killed in the early hours of 30 april after intruders entered his home in ashley , near ringwood .
jason baccus , scott keeping and kevin downton all deny murdering mr hedger .
prosecutors told the court mr keeping had told a prison officer he had `` only gone along for the valuables to fund his drug habit '' .

mr keeping 's wife - who also faces charges of assisting an offender - said mr baccus told her he `` just did a few houses and burgled a couple of faggots '' and that mr downton had been the one who fired the gun .
the case continues .

documents.title: army stunt bikes fetch £ 58k
text: six motorbikes used by the recently-disbanded white helmets motorcycle display team have fetched a total of £ 58,800 at auction .
the customised triumph t140 bikes , which were estimated to reach £ 5,000 to £ 8,000 , were sold for between £ 7,800 and £ 12,000 each at charterhouse auctioneers in sherborne .
the display team made a final farewell parade through its hometown of blandford forum , dorset on 27 september .
the remaining 20 bikes have been donated to museums and sponsors , or returned to motorbike manufacturer lf harris .

documents.title: gaia pope search : police cordon in place after clothes found
text: there is a significant police presence on land north of the dorset coast path after police investigating the disappearance of teenager gaia pope have revealed women 's clothing has been found .
it is not clear who the clothes belong to , but dorset police said gaia 's family have been informed .
gaia , 19 , was last seen nine days ago by family friend rosemary dinch , in swanage , dorset .
an area near durlston country park has been cordoned off after a member of the public found the clothes .
author: Stephen Stafford
BBC South

documents.title: clothing found in search for gaia
text: clothing found in search for gaia

documents.title: rolf harris indecent assault conviction overturned
text: former entertainer rolf harris has had one of 12 indecent assault convictions overturned by the court of appeal .
three judges in london ruled the conviction was `` unsafe '' .
but they dismissed applications by harris , 87 , from bray , berkshire , to challenge the other 11 convictions .
there will be no retrial on the one conviction quashed .
the australian-born tv presenter was jailed in 2014 for 12 indecent assaults , relating to four girls between 1968 and 1986 .
he was jailed for five years and nine months and has since been released from that sentence .
the overturned conviction related to an allegation that harris indecently assaulted an eight-year-old girl in 1969 at an event in portsmouth .

though harris was not in court for the ruling , he said in a statement : `` i have said all along that i did not attend and had never attended the location in portsmouth as this complainant alleged at my first trial .
`` i was not believed and she was i have served a nine-month prison sentence based on her word . ''

documents.title: thousands raised for dying mum 's children
text: thousands raised for dying mum 's children

documents.title: missing gaia pope : cordon set up following discovery of clothing in field
text: a police cordon has been put up following the discovery of women 's clothing in a field in swanage this morning .
dorset police said it was found at 10:28 by a member of the public in an area of open land north of the coastal path .
the family of the missing gaia pope have been informed of the discovery , though the owner of the clothes has not yet been confirmed .
neil devoto , of the crime investigation team , said : `` following the discovery of these items of clothing , a full and thorough search will now take place in the field and surrounding area .
we have seized the clothing and investigations will now be carried out to identify who they belong to .
`` we have updated gaia 's family who continue to be supported by specially-trained officers .
our thoughts remain with them at this very difficult time . ''

documents.title: breakingmissing gaia pope : clothes found in field
text: police searching for missing gaia pope say items of women 's clothing have been found on open land north of the coastal path near swanage .
dorset police
dorsetpolice

the discovery was made at 10.28am to twitter.com/i/web/status/9

documents.title: queen to commission £ 3bn carrier next month
text: the royal navy 's new aircraft carrier will be commissioned by the queen next month .
the £ 3bn vessel - which has been named after her majesty - entered portsmouth harbour for the first time in august .
defence secretary , gavin williamson , says it has been making `` great progress '' in sea trials and will return to portsmouth in a few weeks ' time .
the queen will then visit the carrier on 7 december for the formal commissioning ceremony .

documents.title: gaia pope : father remains hopeful in search for missing teenager
text: the father of teenager gaia pope has said the search for his missing daughter has been the `` toughest thing '' to go through .
the hunt for the 19-year-old , who has severe epilepsy and was last seen on 7 november , is continuing in and around swanage .
it 's been beautiful , it keeps us going .
to feel that strength of everyone helping us - every bit of help is gratefully received and she 's worth every bit of it . ''
we have every hope - every minute that goes by we still have hope .
i ca n't describe it - you can imagine , it 's just about the toughest thing we can go through , ''

it 's beginning to look a lot like christmas thanks to our amazing special maintenance team for their hard work this evening @ twitterid
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 38th for nov 15 . )

documents.title: plan for 500 new homes in dorset
text: a plan to build 500 homes near dorchester will be discussed this evening .
if approved , they would be built on land south of warmwell road , crossways .
of the properties about 35 % would be affordable , and a new doctors surgery and village hall are included in the proposal .
west dorset district council 's planning committee will consider whether to grant full permission for 99 of the homes .
it will also decide if the remaining 401 can have outline permission , which would mean councillors accepted the development in principle subject to further detailed plans being submitted .

documents.title: search for gaia pope continues
text: the family of gaia pope say they `` absolutely believe '' the missing teenager is still alive .
the 19-year-old , who has severe epilepsy , was last seen on 7 november at 16:00 gmt by a family friend rosemary dinch , off morrison road , swanage .
dorset police believes she was captured on cctv running past a house in the same street about 20 minutes before .
images of her at a petrol station earlier in the afternoon have also been released by police .

documents.title: man , 76 , in court after woman , 87 , killed in collision
text: a man will appear in court tomorrow in connection with a fatal collision in bournemouth .
a car hit an 87-year-old bournemouth woman in southbourne road on 26 april .
her legs and head were seriously injured and she later died in hospital .
the driver of the car , a 76-year-old man from bournemouth , is due to appear at poole magistrates ' court charged with causing death by careless driving and failing to stop after a road accident .

documents.title: the oxford college with a 90 % state school intake
text: the oxford college with a 90 % state school intake
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News Online

documents.title: blenheim palace christmas trees in place
text: blenheim palace has ushered in the christmas season with two six-metre-tall christmas trees in its great hall .
they were cut down and transported from elsewhere on the oxfordshire estate by a team of four , before the house guides took over to decorate them using 300 baubles and 180m of lights .

kate ballenger at the unesco world heritage site in woodstock said : `` it 's always something of a military operation to get the trees down to the palace in the first place and then to place them in just the right spot in the great hall .
`` it 's taken three days in total to finish decorating them but the results are truly spectacular and the reaction from our visitors has been very rewarding .
`` as they are living trees they give off a fantastic pine smell which is really helping to get everyone in the festive mood . ''

documents.title: girl , 13 , assaulted in woodley
text: an assault on a 13-year-old girl in woodley , berkshire , is now being linked with three other recent attacks on women .
the teenager was grabbed by a man in lysander close , but managed to get away .
a similar attack was reported nearby on the same evening .
last week an attempted rape and sexual assault took place in winnersh and bracknell .
author: Sam Clayton
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: fire at historic pub 'accidental '
text: a blaze which engulfed the historic swan pub in tetsworth yesterday is believed to have started accidentally , oxfordshire fire and rescue service says .
the a40 was closed for several hours in the morning while fire crews tackled the blaze .
nobody was injured , but fire officers say there 's been considerable damage to the grade ii-listed building .
author: Sophie Law
BBC Radio Oxford news

documents.title: school asks parents for money to pay for pens and books
text: a primary school in wargrave , berkshire , is to ask parents for money to help pay for pens and books .
the robert piggott church of england school is asking for £ 1 every school day in voluntary contributions , amounting to £ 190 a year .
it said `` national changes to school funding '' meant they had to make up the shortfall .
the school is in the maidenhead constituency represented by theresa may since 1997 .
labour said this showed `` tory cuts '' were `` hitting schools badly '' .
education minister nick gibb said the school is set to gain around £ 10k a year in extra cash from 2018 under the new national funding formula .

documents.title: campaign for dark sky status on isle of wight
text: the isle of wight is to campaign to get dark sky status .
it would promote `` astro-tourism '' , particularly in the winter months , and help preserve wildlife .
councillors voted last night to draft a policy on better use of lighting and understanding its impact on the night sky .
only a handful of places in the uk presently have dark sky status , including sark island , exmoor and the scottish isle of coll .
author: Emily Hudson
BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: weather : 'sunny spells , with showers later '
text: weather : 'sunny spells , with showers later '

documents.title: white helmets ' bikes go under hammer
text: bikes belonging to the british army 's disbanded motorcycle display team are being sold at auction in dorset today .
the white helmets made a final farewell parade through the team 's hometown of blandford forum in september .
the triumph t140 bikes have been specially customised for stunts with no rear suspension and a modified throttle .
six of the bikes go under the hammer at charterhouse auctioneers estimated at £ 5,000-£ 8,000 each .

documents.title: gypsy and traveller site numbers 'not being met '
text: fewer than a third of the required number of gypsy and traveller pitches in england have been built , with some funding going unspent .
local authorities have spent almost £ 35m creating 1,800 pitches since 2012 , despite an agreed need for about 6,000 .
the gypsy and traveller council said authorities are `` not living up to legal or moral obligations '' .
the local government association described pitch provision as a `` sensitive '' issue for councils .
some authorities have blamed a lack of suitable land .
tony page , leader of reading borough council , which is currently holding a public consultation over the proposed location of a transit site , said the city was `` very tightly constrained '' .
of 80 sites initially considered he said only one had been identified as `` potentially suitable '' .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to south live , where we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across the region until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our berkshire , hampshire , dorset and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
